the part of a spot on your skin that contains a thick yellow liquid (= pus)
the component of a sound or video recording system that converts data on the disk or tape into digital electronic data (and the other way round)
used to say how many animals of a particular type are on a farm, in a herd, etc.

examples.x: 200 head of sheep

senses.definition: oral sex (= using the mouth to give somebody sexual pleasure)

examples.x: to give head

senses.definition: the central part of a phrase, which has the same grammatical function as the whole phrase. In the phrase ‘the tall man in a suit’, man is the head.
a person who works in healthcare, for example a doctor or nurse

examples.x: There is a shortage of qualified health professionals.

senses.definition: a person who treats illness using homeopathic methods
a person who owns or manages a hotel
a man who stays at home to cook, clean, take care of the children, etc. while his wife, husband or partner goes out to work
a person, usually a woman, whose job is to manage the shopping, cooking, cleaning, etc. in a house or an institution

examples.x: Do come in. My housekeeper will make you a cup of tea.
Miss Mack had been housekeeper at the Hall for many years.

senses.definition: a person whose job is to manage the cleaning of rooms in a hotel
a woman who stays at home to cook, clean, take care of the children, etc. while her husband or partner goes out to work house
a person who draws or paints pictures for books, etc.
a religious man who leads the prayers in a mosque
the title of a Muslim religious leader
connected with industry

examples.x: an industrial dispute
industrial unrest
an industrial accident
Industrial production fell in December by 1.4 per cent.
policy with regard to future industrial development
India has a large industrial sector.
a huge industrial complex
the country's industrial base

senses.definition: used by industries

examples.x: industrial chemicals

senses.definition: having many industries

examples.x: an industrial city/town
an industrial society
the world’s leading industrial nations

senses.definition: very great in extent or amount

examples.x: They had made industrial quantities of food.
They were guilty of fraud on an industrial scale.

senses.definition: a person or thing that influences somebody/something, especially a person with the ability to influence potential buyers of a product or service by recommending it on social media

examples.x: the social media feeds of fashion influencers

senses.definition: an officer of middle rank in the police force

examples.x: Inspector Maggie Forbes
He reached the rank of inspector.

senses.definition: a person whose job is to visit schools, factories, etc. to check that rules are being obeyed and that standards are acceptable

examples.x: a school/health/safety inspector

senses.definition: (in the UK) a person whose job is to check tickets on a bus or train
a person whose job is to teach somebody a practical skill or sport

examples.x: a fitness/driving/ski instructor
a qualified/certified instructor
He worked for a time as an aerobics instructor.

senses.definition: a teacher below the rank of assistant professor at a college or university
the art or job of choosing the paint, carpets, furniture, etc. to decorate the inside of a house

examples.x: an interior design magazine

senses.definition: a period of time during which a student or new graduate gets practical experience in a job, for example during the summer holiday

examples.x: an internship at a television station

senses.definition: a job that an advanced student of medicine, whose training is nearly finished, does in a hospital to get further practical experience
a person whose job is to translate what somebody is saying into another language

examples.x: Speaking through an interpreter, the President said that the talks were going well.
a sign language interpreter (= a person who translates what somebody is saying into sign language for deaf people)
Susan acted as interpreter for us.

senses.definition: a person who performs a piece of music or a role in a play in a way that clearly shows their ideas about its meaning

examples.x: She is one of the finest interpreters of Debussy's music.

senses.definition: a computer program that changes the instructions of another program into a form that the computer can understand and use
a person whose job is to take care of a building such as a school or a block of flats or an apartment building
a person who makes, repairs or sells jewellery and watches
a shop that sells jewellery and watches

examples.x: I bought it at the jeweller's near my office.

senses.definition: work for which you receive regular payment job

examples.x: I don't have a job at present.
He's trying to get a job.
I'm thinking of applying for a new job.
to look for/find a job
Did they offer you the job?
She took a job as a waitress.
She's just started a job with a travel company.
His brother's just lost his job.
to leave/quit your job
Don't be late again if you want to keep your job.
a temporary/permanent job
a summer/Saturday/holiday/vacation job
Both my parents have full-time jobs.
They're both in in part-time jobs.
She's never had a steady job (= a job that is not going to end suddenly).
It's one of the top jobs in management.
one of the people under consideration for the job of managing director
an increase in the number of people in jobs (= having jobs)
He's been out of a job (= unemployed) for six months now.
The takeover of the company is bound to mean more job losses.
There is so much competition in the job market currently.
He certainly knows his job (= is very good at his job).
I'm only doing my job (= I'm doing what I am paid to do).
These projects will help create jobs in rural areas.
The alternative would have been to cut jobs to contain costs.
The closure of the factory will mean the loss of over 800 jobs.

senses.definition: a particular task or piece of work that you have to do

examples.x: I've got various jobs around the house to do.
Sorting these papers out is going to be a long job.
The builder has a couple of jobs on at the moment.
She's taken on the job of organizing the Christmas party.

senses.definition: a responsibility or duty

examples.x: He said he wouldn't do it because it wasn't his job.
It's not my job to lock up!
It's the job of the press to expose wrongdoing.

senses.definition: a crime, especially stealing

examples.x: a bank job
He got six months for that last job he did.
an inside job (= done by somebody in the organization where the crime happens)
The gang bungled the job and got caught.

senses.definition: a particular kind of thing

examples.x: It's real wood—not one of those plastic jobs.

senses.definition: an item of work that is done by a computer as a single unit

examples.x: The job can be processed overnight.

senses.definition: (in the UK in the past) a person who worked on the stock exchange, buying shares, etc. from brokers and selling them to other brokers job
to share the hours of work and the pay of one job between two people

examples.x: She’s looking for someone to job-share with.

senses.definition: an arrangement for two people to share the hours of work and the pay of one job

examples.x: The introduction of job-sharing could prevent the need for job losses.

senses.definition: a person whose job is to make the wooden parts of a building, especially window frames, doors, etc.
a person who joins an organization, club, etc.

examples.x: All joiners will receive a welcome pack.

senses.definition: the work of a joiner or things made by a joiner joiner
a person whose job is to collect and write news stories for newspapers, magazines, radio, television or online news sites

examples.x: a freelance journalist
She's an investigative journalist with a French newspaper.
The minister told journalists he was not going to resign.

senses.definition: a person in a court who has the authority to decide how criminals should be punished or to make legal decisions case law

examples.x: a High Court judge
a federal/district judge
the presiding trial judge
to appoint a judge
The case comes before Judge Cooper next week.
She will appear before a judge tomorrow.
The judge sentenced him to five years in prison.
The judge ruled that the evidence was inadmissible.

senses.definition: a person who decides who has won a competition

examples.x: The judges' decision is final.
She has joined the panel of judges in the popular TV talent show.
He was invited to be a judge in a cookery competition.

senses.definition: a person who has the necessary knowledge or skills to give their opinion about the value or quality of somebody/something

examples.x: She's a good judge of character.
He was a shrewd judge of people.
The last singer was the best—not that I'm any judge (= I do not know much about the subject).
‘I'm not sure that's a good way to do it.’ ‘Let me be the judge of that.’

senses.definition: having a low rank in an organization or a profession

examples.x: a junior partner/minister/officer
She is junior to me.

senses.definition: connected with young people below a particular age, rather than with adults, especially in sports

examples.x: He's a member of the club's junior team.
the world junior tennis championships

senses.definition: (especially in the US) used after the name of a man who has the same name as his father, to make it clear who is being referred to
for children under the age of 11 or 13

examples.x: the junior section of the school

senses.definition: connected with the year before the last year in a high school or college

examples.x: I spent my junior year in France.

senses.definition: a worker in one of the essential services such as health, education or the police

examples.x: The city council helps key workers find affordable housing.

senses.definition: a person whose job involves hard physical work that does not need special skills, especially work that is done outdoors

examples.x: an agricultural laborer

senses.definition: hard physical work that does not need special skills

examples.x: a laboring job
He prefers laboring to working as a waiter.

senses.definition: a person whose job involves hard physical work that does not need special skills, especially work that is done outdoors

examples.x: an agricultural labourer

senses.definition: hard physical work that does not need special skills

examples.x: a labouring job
He prefers labouring to working as a waiter.

senses.definition: a woman that you rent a room, a house, etc. from
a woman who owns or manages a pub or a guest house
a person or company that you rent a room, a house, an office, etc. from

examples.x: a buy-to-let landlord (= who buys houses and flats in order to rent them out)

senses.definition: a man who owns or manages a pub or a guest house
a person whose job is planning and designing the environment, especially so that roads, buildings, etc. combine with the landscape in an attractive way
the job of planning and designing the environment, especially so that roads, buildings, etc. combine with the landscape in an attractive way
a person whose job is designing and creating attractive parks and gardens
the job of designing and creating attractive parks and gardens
a person or company whose work or business is washing, drying and ironing clothes, etc.

examples.x: They worked in the homes of wealthy families as cooks, launderers and gardeners.

senses.definition: a person who commits the crime of money laundering

examples.x: These banks were among the biggest launderers of dirty money.

senses.definition: a person who is trained and qualified to advise people about the law and to represent them in court, and to write legal documents Lawyer

examples.x: to hire a lawyer
You would be wise to consult a lawyer.
a defence lawyer
a trial lawyer
a human rights lawyer
The lawyer representing the family said he was very satisfied with the verdict.
Lawyers for all three defendants said their clients did not intend to kill the victim.

senses.definition: a person who gives a lecture

examples.x: She's a superb lecturer.
Dr David Crystal is our visiting lecturer today.

senses.definition: (especially in the UK) a person who teaches at a university or college

examples.x: He's a lecturer in French at Oxford.

senses.definition: a person who is in charge of or works in a library -an
the job or skill of being in charge of or working in a library

examples.x: a degree in librarianship

senses.definition: a person who is employed by somebody to give them advice about how to achieve the things they want in their life and work
